column4: I did as you said. Nothing. No response. Cursor just sits there
No response, no error message, no action of any kind.
That's right, but without the prompt.
Either something went flaky during the upgrade from Dapper to Edgy, or I punched the wrong button someplace.
Damn. So what do I do? Can I repair my installation or is it totally hosed?
What's IDK?
You too huh?
Any idea as to what else I could do in the way of research, repairs, etc.?
Can I re-run the upgrade?
I've been all over Synaptic. No dice. I wish there were some kind of diagnostic tool.
What's your sources.list look like?  And, what errors does "sudo apt-get dist-upgrade" give?
Pastebin /etc/apt/sources.list (open it in a text editor)
alright, then open a terminal, and 'sudo apt-get dist-upgrade'
I had said to pastebin your sources.list, so I gave you the URL, incase you didn't need it
alright, so, what's going wrong?
in a terminal, type "xmms" and see what errors it gives
but, a quick way to fix it would be to remove xmms (completely), then reinstall
Did you "remove" or "complete removal" in synaptic?
Did you remove the package completely? or just "remove" it?
I am.  I don't know what to say.  It not running, and not giving an error is most odd.
Do you have /home on it's own partition?
Ah, then... yeah.  Backup I suppose.  When you reinstall, you might want to put /home on it's own partition, to cut out the "backup" parts later, you can reinstall around all your personal stuff.
